6-Man Co-op shooter against waves of increasingly strong Zeds. Soon to be a decade old, this game still has a bunch of people playing. Never do I log on and don't see servers of my chosen difficulty.

Pros:
-Awesome Fun
-7 Perks to choose from, each requires a good xp grind to hit max rank
-Tons of maps and a good selection of weapons to use
-Huge modding community adding maps/weapons/skins
-Tripwire still updates the game with Holiday events and new DLC equipement

Cons:
-Modding Character/weapon skins will sometimes disable perk progression until the game is launched again 
-Higher difficulty = more enemies that have even more HP and move faster
-Due to the Xp grind, a casual player may not level up for months when trying to hit the higher ranks


9 types of zeds will make their appearance during your games. Each zed is unique and will try to eat you in some fashion. Where the basic clot is no threat alone, being cornered by a fleshpound can definitly ruin your day. Some zeds require coordination to take out, as does kiting the map if you don't have the fire power to camp one spot. 

For the fun factor and survivability, this game is definitly worth it's price. Killing Floor 2 is on it's way, time to practice zed disposal!

I was quite shocked to pay $5 for this bad boy and though it was gonna be just another typical zombie game but after playing this all I can say is... Wow! This game is just badass. I'm a fan of zombies and even I enjoy left 4 dead but this seems to be better in my opinion due to the fact that you can actually aim down the sights unlike left 4 dead and you can challenge yourself throughout harder difficulties. Plus the music in-game just blends in perfectly and it is just raw! It's on sale right now for $5 so hurry up and buy this bad boy cause it is fuckin' awesome!

It is a great game. You can work together with friends or random people to survive waves of mutants.

Killing Floor, also to be referred to as Grinding Floor, is a team-based survival not-really-horror arcade shooter. It's primary charm is the insane clusterfuck that is usually the staple of ANY game that involves close-ranged combat, and other players are not your friends; they're on the same side, but damned if you didn't have to fight them as well. The following are a list of well-known player archetypes for this game: Demolition specialists that can't aim for shit and will (repeatedly) fire grenades into the back of your head instead of the scrake in front of you, commandos who think they're all that and attempt to fight and aggravate big creatures that is the purview of the sharpshooter instead, sharpshooters who dual wield because they want to do close combat, supports gunning down everything like rambo with their shotguns, medics who solo the entire game because of their body armor, and berserkers being (usually) the most competant player of the bunch. What does this mean? This means that your survival is dependent on people who may or may not knowingly screw you over because the mechanics are not outright defined for new players.

For those who do not know the following, take note: When a berserker is stunlocking a creature with melee, shooting it will cause the creature to break out of stun and maul both you and the berserker who was tanking it. Please do not shoot the creature if you see a berserker stunlocking it.
Additionally, if you are a commando and you have been forced into a situation where you had to shoot and taunt the fleshpound to prevent your idiot teammates from dying, congratulations. You've become a Killing Floor veteran.

If you want to play alone, this game is really boring and you should probably get some friends. If you play with other people, this game can be rage-inducing, very fun, or both. You have been warned.

Also, when are they going to release KF2 and add the PPSh in? I thought the makers of Red Orchestra 2 would actually add more Red Orchestra weapons in...

After 24 hours of playing Killing Floor, not to compare games here but if you like CoD Zombies (or Zeds) you are going to like this. You and 5 others survive wave after wave of clots and other special infected; only way to survive is to shoot and kill to survive. The game though does feel a little limited but nothing that brings the game rating not too far down. Anywho, I recommend this game to those Zombie killers. Rating 7.5/10 very good game.

Killing Floor es un juego con una pinta de bajo presupuesto al mismo nivel que el logo actual de Tripwire. Sin embargo, esto no significa que sea un mal juego, y más adelante explicaré mi comentario anterior. 

[h1]¿Qué es Killing Floor?[/h1]
Se trata de un juego fps cooperativo, donde un equipo de jugadores debe enfrentarse a enemigos tipo zombies/monstruos en distintos modos de juego, existiendo así modos de oleadas dentro de un mapa, como también cumplimiento de objetivos dentro de un mapa lineal. 

[h1]¿Qué me gustó?[/h1]
[olist]
[*]La rapidez con la que se juega. Me recuerda a lo rápido que era entrar a CS 1.6, seleccionar un servidor y jugar.
[*]Bajos requerimientos. El juego no tiene una gráfica de última generación, ya tiene sus años, por lo tanto podrá ser accesible para la mayoría de los que deseen tener un juego multijugador-cooperativo online.
[*]Dificultad. En ciertos mapas, en dificultad "Normal", las cosas se pueden complicar muchísimo. 
[*]Integración a Steam. Existen cromos, y un montón de logros.
[*]Sistema de juego. Las armas y movimientos son buenos, tiene lógica que andar con cuchillo en mano te hará andar más rápido, clásico. También me pareció "original" la capacidad de tirar dinero para que otro lo recoja. Así como subir de niveles e ir mejorando en cierta rama que preferimos (Francotirador, Comando, etc).
[*]La música. Es rock, con eso ya no hay más argumentos.
[/olist]

[h1]¿Qué cosas no me gustaron?[/h1]
[olist]
[*]Las interfaces, principalmente porque son muy básicas. Y cuando son básicas pero funcionables, está bien, pero en KF lamentablemente no siempre es así. Por ejemplo, cuando deseas buscar un servidor, seleccionas que se ordene por ping, y jamás ordena correctamente. Tampoco hay un buen filtro, a pesar de que el filtro de búsqueda de servidores tiene muchas opciones, ninguna es sobre regiones que no quiero ver, ni tampoco sobre servidores en lista negra.
[*]Apropósito de servidores en lista negra. Ya me pasó una vez que entré a X servidor, y luego todos mis niveles volvieron a 0, sin la posibilidad de subirlos otra vez. Tripwire jamás dio solución a esto.
[/olist]

En general, Killing Floor es un juego que te hará pasar buenos momentos. No es muy comunicativo, lamentablemente, es decir, la mayoría de los jugadores con suerte escriben (tal vez sea por lo mal hecha que está la interfaz de chat también) y mucho menos hablan, pero muy pocas veces encuentro "trolls" de KF. 
Los DLC, a mi parecer, no añaden beneficios a quienes los adquieren, por lo tanto no piensen que están frente algún tipo de P2W como ciertas personas dicen.
Espero haberlos ayudado en su decisión :)
